meanings.definition: The part of a bridle that fits over a horse's head, used to control the horse.
meanings.sent1: The headstall on the horse's bridle was made of sturdy leather.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the headstall to make sure the horse was comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous horse tried to chew on the headstall, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The headstall acted as a gentle guide, directing the horse along the path.
meanings.sent5: The shiny headstall gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A strap or band that goes around the head of an animal to hold something in place.
meanings.sent1: The headstall on the cow kept the bell securely in place.
meanings.sent2: The headstall prevented the goat from shaking off the tiny hat.
meanings.sent3: The curious pig managed to slip out of the headstall and run around freely.
meanings.sent4: The headstall acted like a loyal guardian, keeping the birdhouse steady on the tree.
meanings.sent5: The colorful headstall added a touch of flair to the llama's outfit.

meanings.definition: A strap or band that goes around a person's head to hold something in place.
meanings.sent1: The headstall on the diver's mask ensured a tight seal underwater.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the headstall of her headlamp before exploring the dark cave.
meanings.sent3: The headstall of the headband kept slipping, causing her hair to fall in her face.
meanings.sent4: The headstall of the safety helmet protected him during the construction work.
meanings.sent5: The headstall of the VR headset transported her to a virtual world of adventure.
